name: uncharacteristically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not typical of someone: I noticed that this usually social young man was uncharacteristically silent. He looked down at his hands, uncharacteristically shy. See
uncharacteristic
More examplesFewer examplesHe stayed uncharacteristically quiet, saying he didn't want to comment on the subject.She ran an uncharacteristically poor race in Germany at the start of the month.Aunt Sarah hesitated, uncharacteristically, and her tone altered a little.
